question: What is the population of Prairie View?

content.source_1: Prairie View, Kansas Prairie View is a city in Phillips County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, the city population was 134. The first post office in Prairie View (also spelled historically Prairieview) was established in July 1879. Prairie View is located at (39.831737, -99.573324). According to the United States Census Bureau, the city has a total area of , all land. As of the census of 2010, there were 134 people, 51 households, and 41 families residing in the city. The population density was 611.0 people per square mile (235.8/km²). There were 834 housing units at an average density of 115.6 per square mile (44.6/km²). The racial makeup of the city was 3.47% White, 93.51% African American, 0.18% Native American, 0.43% Asian, 1.36% from other races, and 1.04% from two or more races.
